alert.note: Alert for Clay; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Leslie, central Perry and east central Clay Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hosea, or near Hyden, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wendover and Kaliopi around 700 PM EDT. Hyden, Dryhill, Toulouse, Cinda and Confluence around 705 PM EDT. Wooton, Avawam, Frew, Smilax, Daley, Mosley Bend and Cutshin around 710 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hazard, Diablock, Jeff, Viper and Bulan. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 32 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
